message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.AI, cs.IR. 

The paper deals with a computer vision problem of temporal action localization, which involves learning discriminative action features with enhanced localization capabilities. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category. Additionally, the paper proposes a novel formulation to learn these features, which involves a joint formulation with three terms, including a classification term, an adapted multi-label center loss term, and a counting loss term. This suggests that the paper may also belong to the machine learning (cs.LG) sub-category. The paper also performs experiments on two challenging benchmarks, THUMOS14 and ActivityNet 1.2, which suggests that it may belong to the multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category. The paper uses weak supervision in the form of action category labels and the corresponding count, which suggests that it may also belong to the artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category. Finally, the paper involves learning discriminative action features, which suggests that it may also belong to the information retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category.
